Ask the nurses or the doctor if they can give your Mom some ATROPINE drops under her tongue. Sometimes this will help dry the secretions, but not always. Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 05:30AM pbcc1 wrote: The first thing they need to do is a culture and sensitivity. Then you know the bug and what will kill it, without going thru a million pills. Then I would start a routine of daily cranberry juice, even if you have to disguise it in something. Also, drinking a lot of water and frequent bathroom trips (even if you dont "need" to go) will help to keep the bladder empty, giving the bacteria little if any place to grow. She probably isnt emptying her bladder all the way. Lastly, check her blood sugar, if she is diabetic she will be more inclined to get the UTI. Hope that helps some !  Good luck !!
